It is characterized by its smooth, dark-brown bark and elliptical,革质 (leathery) leaves that are dark green on the upper surface and lighter on the underside. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks. Neolaugeria apiculata is valued for its ornamental appeal and has some traditional uses in local medicine.
